message.content: We refer to PubMed for help. Among the options, only Vitamin E has been shown to have a potential protective effect against cardiovascular disease. Folic acid and Vitamin B12 have been shown to improve cardiovascular health, but they are not thought to provide a protective effect. Vitamin K is important for bone health but has not been shown to have a significant effect on cardiovascular health.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options listed, Vitamin E is the supplement that is commonly associated with a protective effect on cardiovascular health. Folic acid is commonly used to prevent birth defects and Vitamin B12 is used to treat anemia. Vitamin K is used to promote blood clotting.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Vitamin E has been shown to provide a protective effect against cardiovascular disease. Folic acid and Vitamin B12 are important for preventing anemia and neural tube defects in pregnancy. Vitamin K is important for blood clotting.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Vitamin E is a known antioxidant that may have a protective effect against cardiovascular disease. Folic acid and Vitamin B12 are important for overall health but there is no evidence of a direct protective cardiovascular effect. Vitamin K is important for blood clotting but does not have a significant protective effect against cardiovascular disease.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only Vitamin E is thought to have a protective cardiovascular effect. Folic acid is used to prevent neural tube defects in fetuses, Vitamin B12 is important for nerve function, and Vitamin K is important for blood clotting.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only Vitamin E has been studied extensively and shown to have a potential protective cardiovascular effect. Folic acid is important for preventing birth defects and anemia but has no direct cardiovascular benefits. Vitamin B12 is important for healthy nerve function and the formation of red blood cells. Vitamin K is important for blood clotting and bone health.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only Vitamin E is known to have a protective cardiovascular effect. Folic acid and Vitamin B12 are needed for proper red blood cell formation and function, not for cardiovascular protection. Vitamin K is important for blood clotting and bone health.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only vitamin E is known to have a protective cardiovascular effect. Folic acid and vitamin B12 are important for red blood cell production and nervous system function, respectively. Vitamin K is important for blood clotting. None of them have been shown to have a significant effect on cardiovascular health.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only Vitamin E can provide a protective cardiovascular effect. Folic acid and Vitamin B12 are used to treat anemia and Vitamin K is involved in blood clotting.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only Vitamin E is known to have a potential protective effect on cardiovascular health. Folic acid and Vitamin B12 are important for red blood cell health, while Vitamin K is important for bone health and blood clotting, but they have no known cardiovascular benefits.
